revision.text: {{WPOccult|class=List|importance=High}} ==Shadowmancy== Shadowmancers exist, i have met one in India in the 70's, their method of divination is by measuring one's shadow. This method is also called "umbraspication" padma@sover.net {{unsignedIP|216.114.169.242|20:40, February 18, 2007 (UTC)}} == Removal of red links == I generally find the removal of [[Wikipedia:Red link|red links]] to be a bad practice. These function as incentives to create articles (or appropriate redirects) for the term in question. __[[User:Meco|meco]] 06:58, 20 June 2007 (UTC) == Wikipedia:Good article candidates - process == Did this article go through the [[Wikipedia:Good article candidates|Good article candidates]] process, i.e. was it reviewed with respect to [[Wikipedia:What is a good article?|What is a good article?]] ([[User:Sdsds|sdsds]] - ''[[User talk:Sdsds|talk]]'') 03:57, 7 September 2007 (UTC) :Can an article that is mostly one huge list be a good article ? I thought they were more likely to get deleted ? See [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia_is_not_a_dictionary|Not a dictionary!]] :But then, what do I know? --[[Special:Contributions/195.137.93.171|195.137.93.171]] ([[User talk:195.137.93.171|talk]]) 04:39, 11 February 2008 (UTC) == Removed Calligromancy == removed :* '''calligromancy''' (kə-lĭg'rə-măn'sē; also '''fontology''', '''cybergraphology'''): by [[blog]]gers' fonts (English ''[[calligraphy|calligr(aphy)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) :* '''cybergraphology''' → see [[methods of divination#C|calligromancy]] above (English ''[[cybernetics|cyber(netics)]]'' + ''[[graphology]]'') Reason - Harry Potter is not real ! [http://www.thrihyrne.net/Fanficrecs.html Thevina's Fanfiction Recommendations] :"Transfigurations" is full of incredible details in regards to an obscure (and author-created) branch of magic called calligromancy Fontology : The body of knowledge dealing with the construction and use of new fonts" (Xerox jargon) There may be a bit more science to [[Graphology]] than divination ? --[[Special:Contributions/195.137.93.171|195.137.93.171]] ([[User talk:195.137.93.171|talk]]) 00:32, 11 February 2008 (UTC) == A? == Is there a reason for not having the letter A included? I know there are forms of Divination that start with A. How come acultomancy has a link to this page that it isn't even listed on? While we're here, the picture is supposedly of an "arithmancer", but no definition for that is provided. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/173.48.35.194|173.48.35.194]] ([[User talk:173.48.35.194|talk]]) 02:43, 8 December 2010 (UTC) == Article seems to actually be a list with no references == This list of words is not referenced to any authoritative source (except a mention of [[Harry Potter]]. Also, it appears to be a list and not an article. Sincerely, –[[User:Mattisse|'''Mattisse''']] ([[User talk:Mattisse|Talk]]) 17:39, 27 May 2008 (UTC) == Harry Potter???????????????!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IT AINT A VALID SOURCE!!!! == Harry Potter is a work of fiction, and very stupid at that, its no valdi source for this list of traditional folk believes...[[User:Undead Herle King|Undead Herle King]] ([[User talk:Undead Herle King|talk]]) 22:23, 11 June 2010 (UTC) == typomancy == Aptly, this seems to be nothing more than a typo in Popular Delusions and the Madness of Crowds - the entry was meant to read 'tyro-' - referring to divination through observing coagulating cheese. Another source might be a typo in the Gutenberg version of the OED - [http://www.tenhand.com/clew/blog/archives/000285.html clew's] Sadly, I think it's necessary to delete the entry suggesting there's a form of divination using typographical errors, although it's amusing... [[User:Adambrowne666|Adambrowne666]] ([[User talk:Adambrowne666|talk]]) 04:58, 20 March 2011 (UTC)
